fields.value: MetLife LTC LifeStage Advantage

fields.name: subtitle
fields.value: Plans-at-a-Glance

fields.name: insurance_header
fields.value: INSURANCE | LONG-TERM CARE

fields.name: company_name
fields.value: MetLife

fields.name: plan_simple_name
fields.value: SIMPLE ADVANTAGE9 PLAN

fields.name: plan_custom_name
fields.value: CUSTOM ADVANTAGE9 PLAN

fields.name: plan_type_description
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: issue_ages_simple
fields.value: Issue Ages 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: issue_ages_custom
fields.value: Issue Ages 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: one_million_note
fields.value: *$1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider

fields.name: optional_rider_shared_care
fields.value: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies

fields.name: optional_rider_nonforfeiture
fields.value: Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or if cancelled by insured; Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Available at initial application only

fields.name: optional_rider_cash_benefit
fields.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

fields.name: guaranteed_purchase_option_summary
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO): Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; 10 Year Premium Payment Rider is not available with GPO.

fields.name: benefit_increase_options_summary
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY): FUTURE PURCHASE OPTION (FPO): Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA; increases occur unless insured rejects in writing; If insured rejects twice in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting. AUTOMATIC COMPOUND INFLATION PROTECTION RIDERS: increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium; Riders available at any time, with additional underwriting.

tables.caption: Simple Advantage vs Custom Advantage plan comparison (top)

rows.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)

fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: Main Section Header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care.

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility.

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative.

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit may be modified to pay 100% of MBA outside the U.S.; EP will be 100 Calendar Days.

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined by NAIC guidelines). Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA. Total benefits paid will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date.

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied. If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured. If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime.

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare; COB and non-duplication not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider.

fields.name: Additional Information Header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility of premium; client should consult a tax advisor.

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services even if the family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal*, 15% Marital*, 15% Residential, 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80-84); 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases.

fields.name: Company and Address
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166

fields.name: Distribution Note
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

rows.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care.
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility.
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative.

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of TBA less benefits paid while insured in the U.S. or 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added to policy, International Benefit may be modified to pay 100% of MBA outside the U.S.; EP will be 100 Calendar Days.

Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel after a substantial premium increase; provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; total benefits paid will not exceed the TBA in effect prior to the nonforfeiture date.
1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization selected by MetLife – no cost to insured; If selected by insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime.
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.
COB and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare; not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider.

tables.caption: Additional Information For All Policies (Item / Details)

rows.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; may impact tax deductibility; consult tax advisor.
MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts; insured can call for caregiving advice even if family member not insured with MetLife.
30% Spousal*, 15% Marital*, 15% Residential, 10% Preferred Health (N/A ages 80-84); 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases.
Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80-84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!).
Premium based on age 30 days prior to application date (underwriting requirements based on age at date of signed application).
With Premium: Date all underwriting requirements are met (Conditional Receipt may apply); Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date.
Insured has 30 days to review policy and, if desired, return it for a full refund.
Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date.

pageClassifications.label: other
reasons: Document is a product brochure/plan-at-a-glance (MetLife LTC LifeStage Advantage) and not an invoice, CMR transport form, or UB04 healthcare claim form.
Layout contains marketing header, plan comparison table, and descriptive rider text typical of an insurance brochure.

pageClassifications.label: other
reasons: Document is a MetLife policy features/benefits information sheet, not an invoice or standardized medical billing form.
Contains policy feature headings, bullets, and company footer rather than fields specific to facility invoices, CMR or UB04 forms.

Nonforfeiture Benefit.value: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse: Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA if policy ends due to non-payment or cancellation after substantial premium increase. Optional Nonforfeiture Rider: must be in effect for 3 years and when policy ends; provides full MBA and reduced TBA equal to greater of total premium paid or 1x MBA (available at initial application only).

sources.snippet: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined by NAIC guidelines). Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA.

Nonforfeiture Rider: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums ... Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Available at initial application only

Premium Payment Options.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; may impact tax deductibility.

sources.snippet: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility of premium; client should consult a tax advisor.
Payment Options | Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO...

Return/Refund of Premium.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

sources.snippet: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.
Return of Premium | If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned...

Simple Inflation.value: Future Purchase Option (FPO): increases MBA and remaining TBA automatically by 5% (available with Custom Advantage only; increases occur unless insured rejects in writing).

sources.snippet: FUTURE PURCHASE OPTION (FPO): Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA; increases occur unless insured rejects in writing; ... (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY)

Compound Inflation.value: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders: increases MBA and remaining portion of TBA at end of previous policy year by either 3% or 5% (no corresponding increase in premium).

sources.snippet: AUTOMATIC COMPOUND INFLATION PROTECTION RIDERS: increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium;

Waiver of Premium.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.

sources.snippet: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.
Premium Waiver | Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.

Survivorship.value: Shared Care Rider: when insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost; insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once TBA under their own policy is exhausted.

sources.snippet: Shared Care Rider: Insured and spouse/partner can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies

Guaranteed Purchase Option.value: GPO: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; premium for increase is at attained age rates; lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; minimum 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time; 10 Year Premium Payment Rider not available with GPO.

sources.snippet: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO): Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; 10 Year Premium Payment Rider is not available with GPO.

Indemnity Benefit.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available with this rider; benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable.

sources.snippet: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

Premium Refund at Death.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

sources.snippet: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

Renewal Premium.value: Premium for increase in coverage under GPO is at attained age rates.

sources.snippet: Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates;

Cancellation.value: Free Look: Insured has 30 days to review policy and return for a full refund. Policy may end due to non-payment of premiums; contingent benefit upon lapse provisions apply following substantial premium increases or cancellation.

sources.snippet: Free Look Period | Insured has 30 days to review policy and, if desired, return it for a full refund.
Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase...

Additional Benefits: (Enter Benefit Desc.value: Bed Reservation: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.

sources.snippet: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.

Additional Benefits: (Enter Benefit Desc.value: International Benefit: Pays 50% of MBA when insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of TBA less benefits paid while insured in the U.S. or 50% of TBA. EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; if Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit may pay 100% of MBA outside U.S. and EP will be 100 Calendar Days.

sources.snippet: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit may be modified to pay 100% of MBA outside the U.S.; EP will be 100 Calendar Days.

ELIMINATION_PERIOD.snippet: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative.

PLAN_TYPE.snippet: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

HOME_AND_COMMUNITY_CARE.snippet: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care.

FACILITY_CARE.snippet: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility.

BED_RESERVATION.snippet: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.

RETURN_OF_PREMIUM.snippet: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

INTERNATIONAL_BENEFIT.snippet: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; ... EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added ... EP will be 100 Calendar Days.

ALTERNATE_SERVICE_PROVISION.snippet: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

CONTINGENT_BENEFIT_UPON_LAPSE.snippet: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined by NAIC guidelines). Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA.

INITIAL_NEEDS_ASSESSMENT.snippet: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied. If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured. If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime.

PREMIUM_WAIVER.snippet: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.

PAYMENT_OPTIONS.snippet: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility of premium; client should consult a tax advisor.

GPO_SUMMARY.snippet: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO): Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; 10 Year Premium Payment Rider is not available with GPO.

BENEFIT_INCREASE_OPTIONS.snippet: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY): FUTURE PURCHASE OPTION (FPO): ... AUTOMATIC COMPOUND INFLATION PROTECTION RIDERS: increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium;

CASH_BENEFIT_RIDER.snippet: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

reasoningNotes: Populated only fields that have explicit evidence in the extraction JSON (plan type, MBA/TBA options, elimination period, home/community/facility care, bed reservation, return of premium, international benefit, care coordination, premium waiver, payment options, benefit increase options, GPO, cash benefit rider, contingent benefit upon lapse, initial needs assessment).
Where multiple related lines of evidence exist (e.g., contingent nonforfeiture benefit and optional nonforfeiture rider), values were combined and confidence reflects the aggregated evidence.

Fields related to specific ADL triggers and many granular items (Ambulating, Bathing, Toileting, Transferring, DME amounts/days, respite, equipment rental, home modifications, etc.) are not present in the extraction and were left null per instruction not to fabricate data.

Simple vs. Compound inflation mapping: FPO (5% increase) mapped to Simple Inflation and the 'Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders' mapped to Compound Inflation. Confidence for these is lower (0.4) because the extraction grouped benefit increase options and indicated availability differences (Custom Advantage only) with lower extraction confidence.
For 'Days or Dollar Based' and 'EP Calendar or Service Days' fields, the presence of '100 Calendar Days' allowed a calendar/days determination with high confidence.
Two 'Additional Benefits' slots were used to capture Bed Reservation and International Benefit as notable extra benefits referenced in the document.

prompt.system:
You are building canonical data for illumifin claims processing. You are given OCR extraction results (fields and tables) for a multi-page document along with page-level document type hints. Classify the overall content into one or more of: 'facility_invoice', 'cmr_form', 'ub04'. Input JSON includes a pages array where each page has fields with IDs, values, and normalized bounding boxes (x, y, width, height all between 0 and 1 relative to the page). When populating sources, always reference the provided field IDs (fieldId) or table IDs (tableId) and include the page number. Table metadata includes column headers/keys and cell-level bounding boxes; include the column name when pointing to table sources. Then produce a JSON object matching this schema exactly: {
  "generatedAt": ISO8601 timestamp,
  "documentTypes": [string],
  "facilityInvoice": { optional, object with keys "general" (dict of canonical field name -> value object) and "lineItems" (list of dict canonicalName->value object) },
  "cmrForm": { optional, similar structure with sections },
  "ub04": { optional, provider fields },
  "notes": [string]
 }.
Each canonical value object must be of form {"value": string or null, "confidence": number 0-1, "sources": [ {"page": int optional, "fieldId": string optional, "tableId": string optional, "column": string optional } ] }. Confidence is your mapping confidence (not OCR confidence). Populate as many facility invoice fields as possible: policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, invoiceNumber, invoiceDate, taxId, totalAmount, balanceDue, credits. For lineItems include description, startDate, endDate, unitType, quantity, amount, balance, totalDue, credits. For CMR include policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, serviceFrom, serviceThrough, careLevelSelection, absenceIndicator (yes/no) plus absenceDetails (departureDate, returnDate, reason, admissionDate, dischargeDate), insuranceIndicator and insuranceSelections (medicare, medicaid, other), signaturePresent (yes/blank) and signatureDate. For UB04 include providerName, providerAddress. Always provide an empty object for a section if it applies but data is missing. If no content applies, set documentTypes to ['other'] and return empty sections. Do not invent data. Leave value as null when evidence is absent. Provide reasoning notes in the notes array when confidence is low.

fields.value: Cash Benefit Rider: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

fields.name: guaranteed_purchase_option_summary
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO): Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; 10 Year Premium Payment Rider is not available with GPO.

fields.name: benefit_increase_options_summary
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY): FUTURE PURCHASE OPTION (FPO): Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA; increases occur unless insured rejects in writing; If insured rejects twice in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting. AUTOMATIC COMPOUND INFLATION PROTECTION RIDERS: increases the MBA and remaining portion of TBA at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium; Riders available at any time, with additional underwriting.

tables.caption: Simple Advantage vs Custom Advantage plan comparison (top)

rows.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)

fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: Main Section Header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services including Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care.

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility.

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative.

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason.

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate.

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limited to the lesser of (1) TBA less benefits paid while insured in the U.S.; or (2) 50% of TBA; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit may be modified to pay 100% of MBA outside the U.S.; EP will be 100 Calendar Days.

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel, following a substantial premium increase (defined by NAIC guidelines). Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA. Total benefits paid will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date.

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied. If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured. If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime.

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits.

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare; COB and non-duplication not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider.

fields.name: Additional Information Header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT). 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact tax deductibility of premium; client should consult a tax advisor.

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services even if the family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal*, 15% Marital*, 15% Residential, 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80-84); 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases.

fields.name: Company and Address
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, New York, NY 10166

fields.name: Distribution Note
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

Policy Delivery Receipt (PDR) must be signed within 30 days of Policy Approval Date.
